title: Smoke peppers Bay Area air as PG&E warns of midweek blackouts
text:
Smoke peppers Bay Area air as PG&E warns of midweek blackouts More

PG&E cut power this weekend to more than 2.5 million people in the largest blackout to prevent wildfires in California's history. Meanwhile, the Kincade Fire continued to burn through Sonoma County early Monday morning, destroying homes and other structures. With other wildfires and spot fires burning throughout California — including the Tick Fire near Santa Clarita — California Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a state of emergency on Sunday.

Meanwhile, the Kincade Fire continued to burn through Sonoma County early Monday morning, destroying homes and other structures.  With other wildfires and spot fires burning throughout California — including the Tick Fire near Santa Clarita — California Gov. Gavin Newsom declared a state of emergency on Sunday.
